description:
Manulife is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We have more than 40,000 employees, over 116,000 agents serving ~34 million customers worldwide, and over $1.3 trillion in assets under management and administration.
Visit www.Manulife.com to find out more.

For Manulife terms of use, please visit http://bit.ly/SM_Terms
name: Manulife

updates.text:
Today I shared my decision to retire next May at our Annual General Meeting and that Phil Witherington has been appointed as my successor. 

It has been my honour to serve as Manulife’s President and CEO, and I am humbled to have had the opportunity to play a lead role in shaping the future of such an historic company. I’m extremely proud of our team’s many accomplishments. We’ve delivered superior operating results, de-risked our business, and become a digital customer leader in our industry. 

More importantly, Manulife is a radically transformed company today, built on an exceptionally strong foundation and with tremendous momentum that will carry us to even greater heights.

Our performance and disciplined execution have enabled us to deliver market leading total shareholder return and wouldn’t have been possible without the incredible dedication and engagement of our outstanding global team.

Phil and I have worked together for over a decade, and I know that the Board could not have selected a better successor. Phil’s deep expertise and experience, principled leadership, and ability to drive change are exactly what’s needed as Manulife writes its next chapter. 
 
As for what comes next for me, I can now pursue some of the many other passions that I have. Of course, I’ll spend more time with my family in Canada and abroad. And I’ll focus on mentoring the next generation of business leaders and innovators, investing in health and longevity, which is a personal passion of mine, and philanthropy. 

To my colleagues across Manulife: thank you for the privilege of leading our phenomenal team. While I’m incredibly proud of the results we’ve achieved, what I will always be most proud of is the culture we’ve built. And I know I will miss one of the most amazing groups of people I’ve had the opportunity to work with in my career.

For the fourth year in a row, we've been recognized as a top employer by Canada's Top 100 Employers for being an exceptional workplace. This special recognition reinforces our ongoing work to build a #WinningTeam and culture, where our colleagues can bring their authentic selves to work and achieve their full potential.

We recently hosted a collaborative food festival across our offices to bring colleagues together to learn more about our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). ERGs are volunteer, colleague-led groups that are structured and designed to support colleagues with shared identities and who are part of marginalized groups that face barriers related to race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, or cultural backgrounds. They provide a space for colleagues to build networks, share experiences, and contribute to our global DEI efforts. #ManulifeInclusion

On Remembrance Day, we are recognizing and honouring the brave individuals who have served our country and those who have made the ultimate sacrifice. Our Global Chief Marketing Officer Karen Leggett, members of the Canadian Armed Forces, and colleagues across the country came together for a service of remembrance. The commemorative ceremony, which was held on the lawn of our global headquarters in Toronto, honours military members, both past and present.  The sacrifices made by these individuals have given us the freedoms and values we enjoy today. #CanadaRemembers

Last week, a number of our leaders and colleagues attended The Grace Hopper Celebration in Philadelphia. We are a proud sponsor of the conference, which is the world’s largest gathering of women and non-binary technologists. The event is named in honour of Grace Hopper, who was a computer scientist and U.S. Navy rear admiral. The goal of the event is to empower tomorrow’s innovators and equip women in technology with the skills, knowledge and networks necessary to drive innovation and lead transformative change in the digital age.
We wish everyone celebrating a bright and happy Diwali.
